name: Familiar Names, Unknown People Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Noah Webster is intimately associated with the idea of a dictionary. When did Webster live?
questions.explanation:
American Revolutionary Period.

	Webster was born in 1758. His work came out in the early part of the nineteenth century.

questions.text: The mention of the word "thesaurus" immediately makes one think of (Peter Mark) Roget. What was unusual about Roget's work?
questions.correct: He started it at a very old age
options: He started it at a very young age
He created it despite opposition from many prominent people
He created it without any formal education of any kind
questions.explanation:
He started it at a very old age.

	He began work on the project in his 70's.

questions.text:
John Bartlett's name is closely associated with familiar quotations. 
What did Bartlett do for a living?
questions.explanation:
Worked in a bookstore.

	Bartlett, whose life covered most of the nineteenth century, worked in a university bookstore.

questions.text: Robert Ripley gave us "Ripley's Believe It or Not". Which of the following is true about Ripley's life?
options: He had a background as an artist and cartoonist
He had an interest in professional sports
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	He reportedly visited almost 50 countries in his quest for the "unusual".

questions.text: Henry Robert gave us "Robert's Rules of Order". Who was Robert?
questions.explanation:
Army Engineer.

	He was an army engineer who felt the need to impart "orderliness" and "parliamentary procedure" to those who were unfamiliar with such matters.

questions.text: Clausewitz (or Von Clausewitz) is most closely associated with what area?
questions.explanation:
Warfare.

	Von Clausewitz' "On War" is regarded as a classic by those who study the field.

questions.text: Kate Turabian is associated with what area of expertise?
questions.explanation:
Writing Style.

	Turabian's "Manual for Writers" is an invaluable--or, at least, handy--guide for college students and others who have papers to prepare.

questions.text: In what area is Judith Martin famous?
questions.explanation:
Etiquette.

	She's better known as "Miss Manners". For those people who care about what is "proper" in "society"...

questions.text: We all know a bit about Thomas Edison and Alexander Graham Bell--how about George Eastman--the key figure in the development of Eastman Kodak. Which statement is true of him?
questions.explanation:
Horatio Alger type success story.

	He lost his father at an early age, but worked his way up to "giant" status.

questions.text: Everyone has heard of the "King James Bible". Of whom was he a contemporary?
questions.explanation:
Shakespeare.

	He was a King of England (and of Scotland). He lived during the Elizabethan period and was (among other things) a patron of the arts who was partial to Shakespeare.
